actions.text: workaround for drop, since it will trigger on drop otherwise
first call to saveCommandPosition, just in case the position changed because of scroll
second call saveCommandPosition, after shifting active position without the dragged command

children.name: TouchPanID
children.comment: ID of the touch using to pan

children.name: TouchZoomID
children.comment: ID of second touch using to zoom

children.name: TouchLastX
children.comment: Initial X position of touch (for pan)

children.name: TouchLastY
children.comment: Initial Y position of touch (for pan)

children.name: TouchStartDistance
children.comment: Initial distance apart of touches (for zoom)

children.text: If the user touches, and we're not already panning with a different touch, store the touch ID and the position of the touch. Note we get the position of the touch from a separate layer which has a parallax of 0, otherwise panning the view would alter the reported touch position, resulting in confusing feedback loops.

Otherwise if we're already panning with a touch, this must be a second touch. Use this second touch to zoom the display. We need to remember the starting distance apart of the touches, as well as the starting layout scale, in order to calculate the zoom. Also store the mid-point of the touches, so we can still pan while zooming.

While we have a touch to pan with, and we're not zooming, offset the scroll position by the change in position of the touch. This makes the view scroll with the touch. Note we also need to take in to account the layout scale to pan correctly at different zoom levels.
If there is a second touch we're zooming with, adjust the layout scale based on the distance between the touches. Also calculate the new mid-point of the two touches and keep panning based on that.

children.name: TouchCurrentDistance
children.comment: The current distance apart of the touches (for zoom)

children.name: TouchCurrentMidX
children.comment: The current average position of the touches for panning while zooming

children.name: TouchCurrentMidY
children.comment: The current average position of the touches for panning while zooming

children.text: When the touch we are panning or zooming with ends, reset the stored touch ID so we stop the action.
If we stop the first (panning) touch while zooming, make the second (zooming) touch become the new panning touch.
